title: Sketch Class: Going Places—Poster Impressionism
short_description: Multi-session sketch class over six weeks
description:
Six Saturdays
June 1–July 6
10:45–12:45

This program is for people ages 16 and up. Some prior drawing experience is recommended, though not required.

Explore painting and poster art in this six-week class inspired by the Belle Epoque, which saw the heyday of fine art posters in the 1890s. Participants will transform Impressionism-inspired sketches into graphic, poster-like images. 

About the Instructor
Mark Krisco is an art history lecturer and sketch instructor with over 25 years of experience at the Art Institute. In addition to lecturing at SAIC and the Oxford Round Table, he has served as curator for the Dr. Martin and Francey Gecht Collection, the Marshall Field’s Archives, and the Pope John Paul II Newman Center in Washington, DC.

See all upcoming sketch classes and workshops. For additional information, please call (312) 443-3680 or email museum-programs@artic.edu. 

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an e-mail to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
